request.description: Create and add an API key to your organization.

variable.description: For security reasons, this is the "id" of the key, not the key itself.

query.description: string for search. Only works with pagination
Boolean for whether to use pagination.
Get results 'Before' the marker passed into this parameter. Marker string comes from response
Get results 'After' the marker passed into this parameter. Marker string comes from response
Page size limit. Only available with pagination. If more than the max of 200 is supplied, the limit will be 200

request.description:
Get all attributes for a trafficType. Non-paginated operation is deprecated, prefer setting the paginate flag to true. When using pagination, the default markerLimit is 50, maximum markerLimit is 200.

Pagination examples:

- Page Forward: Send Next Marker into After Marker parameter
    
- Reload Page (when paging forward): Send Previous Marker into After Marker parameter
    
- Page Backwards: Send Previous Marker into Before Marker parameter
    
- Reload Page (when paging backwards): Send Next Marker into Before Marker parameter

Save an attribute for a traffic type ID. The attribute is created if it does not exist, and is overwritten completely with the provided attribute object if it does. This endpoint also accepts a PUT that behaves identically to the POST, but the POST is preferred. Use the PATCH endpoint for partial updates. The attribute ID must start with a letter followed by a combination of dashes(-), underscores(_), letters(a-z A-Z), or numbers(0-9).

body.raw:
{
    "id": "someAttr",
    "trafficTypeId": "{{traffictype-id}}",
    "displayName": "Some Attribute",
    "description": "This is an attribute updated",
    "dataType": "STRING",
    "isSearchable": true,
    "suggestedValues": [
        "A",
        "B"
    ]
}

request.description: POST is preferred. See documentation.

Delete an attribute schema by its traffic type and attribute ID. This removes any stored data for that attribute from all Identities (keys) in the Split application. The change to Identity keys is processed asynchronously for traffic types with many Identities it may take up to a minute. However, the Attribute delete occurs synchronously, and if the http call returns as a success (2XX), then the attribute is successfully deleted.
Partial update of an attribute. Any fields not sent in the body cause no changes, fields sent as null in the body remove them from the attribute.

Bulk upload attributes. If an attribute already exists, it is replaced. This endpoints accepts either JSON or CSV form uploads. If there is an issue parsing any of the attributes, an error is thrown and attributes with issues are sent back with error messages. The maximum size for a CSV file is 1MB, and CSVs must be encoded as UTF-8. The attribute ID must start with a letter followed by a combination of dashes(-), underscores(_), letters(a-z A-Z), or numbers(0-9).

body.raw:
[
    {
        "id": "someAttr",
        "organizationId": "{{org-id}}",
        "trafficTypeId": "{{traffictype-id}}",
        "displayName": "Some Attribute",
        "description": "This is an attribute",
        "dataType": "STRING",
        "isSearchable": true,
        "suggestedValues": [
            "A",
            "B"
        ]
    },
    {
        "id": "anotherAttr",
        "organizationId": "{{org-id}}",
        "trafficTypeId": "{{traffictype-id}}",
        "displayName": "Another Attribute",
        "description": "This is also an attribute",
        "dataType": "NUMBER",
        "isSearchable": true,
        "suggestedValues": [
            "0",
            "1"
        ]
    }
]

request.description: Bulk upload attributes. If an attribute already exists, it is replaced. This endpoints accepts either JSON or CSV form uploads. If there is an issue parsing any of the attributes, an error is thrown and attributes with issues are sent back with error messages. The maximum size for a CSV file is 1MB, and CSVs must be encoded as UTF-8. The attribute ID must start with a letter followed by a combination of dashes(-), underscores(_), letters(a-z A-Z), or numbers(0-9).

item.description: Approval Flows support via Public Admin API

request.description: Get a list of environments.

Creates an environment

Skipping approvals requires passing the approvalSkippableBy attribute in the payload. However, it’s only allowed if the approvers are required or restricted. Also, as for this current version Administrators must be the only group that can skip the approvals.

``` json
"approvalSkippableBy": [
{
"id": "",
"name": "Administrators",
"type": "group"
}
]
 ```
Deletes an environment

Updates an environment.

With Skip Approvals  
Skipping approvals requires passing the approvalSkippableBy attribute in the payload. However, it’s only allowed if the approvers are required or approvers are restricted. Also, as for this current version, Administrators must be the only group that can skip the approvals. Modifying the name might cause issues in the user interface.

``` json
"approvalSkippableBy": [
{
"id": "",
"name": "Administrators",
"type": "group"
}
]
 ```

item.name: FEATURE FLAGS

request.description: Retrieves the feature flags for a workspace.
Retrieves the feature flag.
Create a feature flag in a workspace given a traffic type. This API does not configure the flag in any environment.
Allows updating the feature flag description, tags, and rollout status.
Changes the description of a particular feature flag.
Deletes a feature flag from a workspace. Must first delete feature flag definitions for the feature flag in all environments in the workspace or this request will fail.

item.name: List Feature Flag Definitions in Environment

request.description: Retrieves the feature flag definitions given an environment.

request.description: Retrieves a feature flag definition given the name and the environment.

request.description: Configures a feature flag definition for a specific environment.

item.name: Full Update Feature Flag Definition in Environment

request.description: Performs a full update of a feature flag definition for a specific environment.

request.description: Unconfigures a feature flag definition for a specific environment. Any SDK calling this feature flag returns "control" for the selected environment.

Restores a feature in a specific environment.

request.description: List all active groups in the organization.
List all active, deactivated, and pending users in the organization.

Create or overwrite identities for a given traffic type and environment. The attribute ID must start with a letter followed by a combination of dashes(-), underscores(_), letters(a-z A-Z), or numbers(0-9).

Create or overwrite a single key for a given traffic type and environment. The attribute ID must start with a letter followed by a combination of dashes(-), underscores(_), letters(a-z A-Z), or numbers(0-9).

Update a single key for a given traffic type and environment. Any provided attribute values are overwritten, but existing values otherwise remain. The attribute ID must start with a letter followed by a combination of dashes(-), underscores(_), letters(a-z A-Z), or numbers(0-9).
Delete a key from a given traffic type and environment.

item.name: RESTRICTIONS
item.description: Restricts operations on a resource. Only workspace view can be restricted for now.

request.description: Use this endpoint to see what the available rollout statuses are in a given workspace.
Lists segments in your organization for a given workspace.
Create a segment in your organization given a traffic type. This API does not configure the segment in any environment.
Delete a segment from your organization. This automatically unconfigures the segment definition from all environments.
Lists segments in your organization for a given workspace.
Creates a Segment Metadata in a workspace.
Deactivate a segment in an environment.
Retrieve segments keys for a given existing segment.

item.name: Update Segment Keys in Environment via CSV

request.description: Bulk upload a CSV file containing a list of identifiers. The segment must exist before calling this endpoint. Segments are limited to 100,000 members and each call can only include 10,000 new members at a time.

Bulk upload a list of identifiers via JSON to a segment. The segment must exist before calling this endpoint. Segments are limited to 100,000 members and each call can only include 10,000 new members at a time.
Delete a list of segment keys via JSON from an existing segment.

item.name: Remove Segment Keys From Environment with Comment

request.description: Use tags to organize and manage feature flag, segments, and metrics across the Split user interface. Use this endpoint to associate tags with existing feature flags.

item.name: TRAFFIC TYPES

request.description:
https://docs.split.io/reference/get-traffic-types

Not yet tested
Deletes traffic type.

item.description:
A traffic type is a particular identifier type for any hierarchy of your customer base. Traffic types in Split are completely customizable and can be any database key you choose to send to Split, e.g.,. a user ID, account ID, IP address, browser ID, etc. Any internal database key you're using to track what "customer" means to you.

The creation and editing of traffic types are limited to administrators within the Split application.

request.description: List all active, deactivated, and pending users in the organization.
Get a user by their user Id.
Get a user by their user Id.

item.name: WORKSPACES

request.description:
Retrieves the Workspaces for an organization.

The result set of the API may be subject to reduction based on the Workspace View Restrictions.

Allows you to create workspaces.

Note: When you create a workspace from this API, this won't create the default environment. You must use the create environment API to create an environment.
Deletes a workspace.
This endpoint provides a partial update for a workspace.

item.description: Workspaces allow you to separately manage your feature flags and experiments across your different business units, product lines, and applications.
